awd_titl_txt: Quantitative Investigation of the Density Field of          Aerodynamic High-Speed Flows using Holograms from a Focused Schilieren System: (Research Initiation Award)
awd_abstract_narration: An experimental study will be conducted, under a Research                       Initiation Award, of supersonic flow with shock waves interacting               with frictional boundary layers.  A novel focused Schlieren                     technique will be used to form holograms of the three-dimensional               density gradients in the flow field.                                                                                                                            The technique, if successful, could be implemented in conventional              high speed windtunnels, and thus perhaps gain widespread usage in               the future in the diagnosis of three-dimensional supersonic flows.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
